snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo used the annual address to burnish his record and lay out proposals that would extend well into the second term he hopes to win this fall.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo uses annual State of the State address to burnish his record and lay out proposals that could extend well into second term he hopes to win in fall; pledges to continue to lower taxes and pushes his plan to make universal prekindergarten classes a priority.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and JESSE McKINLEY
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting from Albany, and Benjamin Weiser from New York City.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo used the annual address to burnish his record and lay out proposals that would extend well into the second term he hopes to win this fall.

headline.main: In Speech, Cuomo Pledges Lower Taxes and Statewide Pre-K
headline.print_headline: In Speech, Cuomo Pledges Lower Taxes and Statewide Pre-K
